aima.core.util.math

Class Interval<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.util.math.Interval<C>

  • public class Interval<C>
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic supports for Intervals.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone
    See Also:
    Interval

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval() 
      Interval(java.lang.Comparable<C> lower, boolean lowerInclusive, java.lang.Comparable<C> upper, boolean upperInclusive)
      Constructs an interval from the two specified end points.
      Interval(java.lang.Comparable<C> lower, java.lang.Comparable<C> upper)
      Constructs a closed interval from the two specified end points.

        public Interval(java.lang.Comparable<C> lower,

        Constructs a closed interval from the two specified end points.
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower end point of the interval
        upper - the upper end point of the interval

      • Interval

        public Interval(java.lang.Comparable<C> lower,
        boolean lowerInclusive,
        java.lang.Comparable<C> upper,
        boolean upperInclusive)
        Constructs an interval from the two specified end points.
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower end point of the interval
        lowerInclusive - wether or not the lower end of the interval is inclusive of its value.
        upper - the upper end point of the interval
        upperInclusive - whether or not the upper end of the interval is inclusive of its value.
